questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is deploying mobile and remote access in an environment that already had functioning Business to Business calling. Mobile and remote access SIP registrations are failing. To troubleshoot, SIP logs were collected. How is this issue resolved?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A diagnostic log from Expressway-C shows a SIP/2.0 405 Method Not Allowed message in response to the Registration request sent by the Jabber client. This is likely due to an existing Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) trunk between Expressway-C and CUCM using port 5060/5061. In order to correct this issue, change the SIP port on the SIP Trunk Security Profile that is applied to the existing SIP trunk configured in CUCM and the Expressway-C neighbor zone for CUCM to a different port such as 5065.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/expressway/118798-technote-cucm-00.html#anc16

Selected Answer: B
In order to correct this issue, change the SIP port on the SIP Trunk Security Profile that is applied to the existing SIP trunk configured in CUCM and the Expressway-C neighbor zone for CUCM to a different port such as 5065.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct, this is a common issue. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/expressway/118798-technote-cucm-00.html#anc16

choices.A: Change the SIP profile on the SIP trunk for the Expressway-E to Standard SIP Profile for TelePresence Endpoint
choices.B: Change the ג€Incoming Portג€ in the SIP Trunk Security Profile for the Expressway-C to not match SIP line registrations
choices.C: Enable autoregistration for the appropriate DN range on the Cisco UCM servers running the CallManager service
choices.D: Write a custom normalization script since the ג€vcs-interopג€ normalization script does not allow registrations

choices.A: Mobile and remote access login has not been enabled for the domain configured in the Expressway-C. The domain must be edited to allow Cisco UCM registrations.
choices.D: Although a traversal client zone exists, there is no Unified Communications traversal client zone. One must be created.
choices.C: No Cisco UCM servers are configured in the Expressway-C. Servers must be added for CallManager and IM and Presence services.
choices.B: SIP is disabled on the Expressway-E. The SIP protocol must be enabled on the server.

discussion.content: D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Unified CM registrations and IM&P say the "domain is configured but no active zone connection. This link has the suggestion from the Mentor in the Community thread.

https://community.cisco.com/t5/other-collaboration-subjects/cisco-vcs-mra-there-are-no-unified-communications-traversal/td-p/2693645
While D could be correct. CUCM is not configured in the Exp-C here. Wouldn't that need to be resolved first before the UC Traversal Zone could work?

comments.content: Disregard. I see the active IM&P and Unified CM servers under the Server section.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. If you look at the bottom of the diagram, it shows a CUCM server configured and also states at the very bottom that the UC traversal zone is not configured

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Logins and failing via mobile and remote access. How is this resolved?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Also, this was mentioned in the doc.

 † Unified CM can listen on 5061 for TCP SIP but we discourage it.

* If you have MRA connections to the Unified CM, which are line-side connections to 5060/5061, then you should
avoid using 5060/5061 as the listening port for any SIP trunks you create on that Unified CM.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X12-5/Cisco-Expressway-IP-Port-Usage-for-Firewall-Traversal-Deployment-Guide-X12-5.pdf

Selected Answer: C
Should be C
Should be C

Page 131 on following LINK: https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2018/pdf/BRKUCC-2801.pdf
C is correct

comments.content:
You are correct sir, C is the answer:
Source: https://video.cisco.com/video/5828524592001

discussion.content: must be C

choices.B: The listening port on the Expressway-C for SIP TLS must be changed to a value other than 5061
choices.A: The listening port on the Expressway-C for SIP TCP must be changed to a value other than 5060
choices.D: The listening port on the Cisco UCM for the Expressway-C SIP trunk is set to something other than 5060 or 5061. It must be set to 5060 for insecure and 5061 for secure SIP
choices.C: The listening port on the Cisco UCM for the Expressway-C SIP trunk must be changed to something other than 5060 or 5061

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.B: The domain pod1.local must be deprovisioned from the Webex cloud for Jabber logins.
choices.D: The username jabberuser@pod1.local is invalid. The user should instead sign-in simply as jabberuser.
choices.A: Skype for Business mode must be disabled on the DNS server because it conflicts with Jabber login requirements.
choices.C: A DNS SRV record must be created for _collab-edge._tls.pod1.local that points to the Expressway-E.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The administrator attempted to log in, but Jabber clients cannot log in via mobile and remote access. How is this issue resolved?

discussion.content: Traffic is coming from the internet so can not be the cisco_uds record, as it is created on the internal DNS only. Collab_edge is the external DNS record. It has to be port blocked or traversal zone down
Either port blocked, or the UC traversal zone is down.

Selected Answer: DE
D & E are correct. The links in the comments do not refer to UC Zone at all.

Selected Answer: DE
there is no unified communications zone, it is for sure DE, the _cisco-uds record must be present

Selected Answer: DE
There is no "Unified Communications zone", B can't be right....cannot assume it refers to "Unified Communications traversal zone"

Selected Answer: DE
Traffic coming through an MRA pair (C&E) DOES use the _cisco-uds record to get from the C to CUCM. B is wrong because there is no unified Communications Zone (there is a UC Traversal zone, close, but different) in the expressway. Since the 8443 traffic is actually destined for CUCM, if the _cisco-uds record is botched, it won't get there...and thus it will be unreachable.

Selected Answer: BE
B and E. Collab-edge is used for MRA, not UDS.

Selected Answer: BE
Should be BE

comments.content: Nothing in this link specifies anything about a "UC Zone". It does mention both the _cisco-uds SRV and firewalls blocking ports,

discussion.content:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/expressway/118798-technote-cucm-00.html#anc6
Topic 1
B - The Unified Communications zone is down. 
E - Firewall is blocking.
D and E are correct

comments.content: Not D, cisco-uds is an internal srv, collab-edge is the external (internet facing) srv record

questions.question_text: What are two reasons why port 8443 is unreachable from the Internet to the Expressway-E? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Transform is not configured on Expressway-E.
choices.E: The firewall is blocking the port.
choices.B: The Unified Communications zone is down.
choices.D: The SRV record for _cisco-uds is misconfigured.
choices.A: The MRA license is missing on the Expressway-E.
